verses.verse: (Job 22:27; (Zech. 13:9)) Call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall glorify Me.”
But to the wicked God says: “What right have you to declare My statutes, Or take My covenant in your mouth,
(Neh. 9:26; Rom. 2:21) Seeing you hate instruction And cast My words behind you?
When you saw a thief, you ((Rom. 1:32)) consented with him, And have been a (1 Tim. 5:22) partaker with adulterers.
You give your mouth to evil, And (Ps. 52:2) your tongue frames deceit.
You sit and speak against your brother; You slander your own mother’s son.
These things you have done, and I kept silent; ((Rom. 2:4)) You thought that I was altogether like you; But I will rebuke you, And ((Ps. 90:8)) set them in order before your eyes.
“Now consider this, you who ((Job 8:13)) forget God, Lest I tear you in pieces, And there be none to deliver:
Whoever offers praise glorifies Me; And (Gal. 6:16) to him who orders his conduct aright I will show the salvation of God.”

A Prayer of Repentance To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David (2 Sam. 12:1) when Nathan the prophet went to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba. [1] Have mercy upon me, O God, According to Your lovingkindness; According to the multitude of Your tender mercies, ((Is. 43:25; 44:22; Acts 3:19; Col. 2:14)) Blot out my transgressions.
(Jer. 33:8; Ezek. 36:33; (Heb. 9:14; 1 John 1:7, 9)) Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, And cleanse me from my sin.
For I acknowledge my transgressions, And my sin is always before me.
(2 Sam. 12:13) Against You, You only, have I sinned, And done this evil ((Luke 5:21)) in Your sight— (Rom. 3:4) That You may be found just when You speak, And blameless when You judge.
((Job 14:4; Ps. 58:3; John 3:6; Rom. 5:12)) Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity, And in sin my mother conceived me.
Behold, You desire truth in the inward parts, And in the hidden part You will make me to know wisdom.
(Ex. 12:22; Lev. 14:4; Num. 19:18; Heb. 9:19) Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; Wash me, and I shall be ((Is. 1:18)) whiter than snow.
Make me hear joy and gladness, That the bones You have broken ((Matt. 5:4)) may rejoice.
Hide Your face from my sins, And blot out all my iniquities.
((Ezek. 18:31; Eph. 2:10)) Create in me a clean heart, O God, And renew a steadfast spirit within me.
